medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive, bilateral, severe thigh pain, lower limb weakness, and difficulty ambulating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Thigh pain began as vague aching in April 2008 at age 62, initially in the left thigh and later in both thighs. The pain intensified, and by June 2008 required two crutches and narcotics for pain. An MRI confirmed bilateral stress fractures with edema, and the severity of the thigh pain continued despite treatment with large doses of oral Vitamin D.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Inflammatory bowel disease at age 17 years requiring high-dose oral and intravenous corticosteroids; past fragility fractures in the sacrum and proximal humerus from falls.
medical_history.social_history: Never smoked cigarettes or drank alcohol excessively.
